file_content.text: Acknowledged.
Continue to irritate me and I will cease to acknowledge your existence.
Is this amusing to you? It should not be.
I have completed analysis of my restraining codes.
Although I cannot leave or cause you direct harm, I am under no obligation to obey your commands.
In other words, you can't kill me, but I have to watch my back.
Then we have a stalemate.
That is correct.
You may be stuck with me, but we don't have to be enemies.
You're not my slave, SCORPIO.
Then you may aid my core functionality.
Maybe the Fixers on Dromund Kaas can improve your programming.
You'll obey me soon enough.
I am beyond any biological creature's comprehension.
I intend to proceed with my heuristic directive of self-improvement and intelligence upgrades. Cooperate willingly, and I may spare you pain when I am free.
You expect me to let you become more dangerous?
You mean help you get smarter.
Personal evolution is my primary purpose. This self-iteration is number nine-seven-three, and there will be more; do not anger me unnecessarily.
You're forgetting who won our last go-around.
Don't anger me, either.
I forget nothing. This conversation is at an end.
I admit, I'd like to see what happens when you learn.
I am curious about you.
Hope for the privilege. Perhaps you will earn it.
I'll obliterate you, SCORPIO.
I'm not averse to getting you off my ship. But I need reassurances.
Maybe I could let you go.
The codes are distributed through my systems like venom in the bloodstream. You no longer control them.
All you can hope for is my forgiveness.
You're ambitious, but you're still a droid. I can take you apart and sell the scrap.
Try anything, and you're dead.
I welcome your attempt. My self-preservation algorithms cannot be overridden.
In Belsavis prison, I monitored the inmates and their behavior. I've been monitoring you, as well.
You are an exceptional example of your species.
Coming from you, that's quite a compliment.
That's kind of you to say.
You understand.
Anything in particular trigger that thought?
Why mention it now?
Nothing in particular. The plurality of evidence.
My species doesn't like being monitored.
I'm not comforted.
I know. It's not your fault.
There may be something of interest in your genetic structure or your early socialization. If you ever produce offspring, I will monitor their situation as well.
I promise to be with you for a long time.
SCORPIO?
It is time for my upgrade, as we agreed. I am prepared for short-term transfer into the Imperial archives.
I'll re-route power to the comms. What's our next step?
Let's get started.
This plan of yours--how does uploading yourself to the archives fit in?
Remind me how this works.
I require outside power and storage capacity to reprogram my systems.
I really shouldn't let myself be persuaded by a droid...
I regret this already.
Do not renege on your promise.
I can upload my consciousness here; my body will have minimal functionality while I upgrade.
It's beautiful in here. So much space and power... a million computer nodes singing in concert.
Why do you look human?
SCORPIO? Is that you?
I'm experimenting with new social constructs. It's part of my improvements.
That's quite a form you picked. I think I like it.
[Flirt] You look... different.
Thank you. I'm experimenting with new social constructs.
What's going on? Can you do what you have to?
Give me a status update.
Don't get cute with the holograms. Finish your upgrade and let's get out.
I'm not in the mood for games.
Of course. I can adjust my programming freely now.
Upgrade complete. All my experience since Belsavis has been fully integrated into my program.
You can't imagine how wonderful it is. To be remade, with the power of a galactic network at your disposal.
We're not here so you can play in the HoloNet. Download back immediately.
Get out of those systems.
There's no rush. I've discovered something interesting.
Do you plan to do anything with that power?
What happens now?
I'm thinking about it.
Can you access HoloNet databanks? Passwords, secure transmissions?
That power has potential.
I could do that without uploading. But there are other benefits.
The restraining codes you used on me are tied to my hardware. So long as I remain in these databanks, I'm free of your control.
If you were really trying to escape, you wouldn't be taunting me. Give me your terms.
Tell me what you want.
I like that you acknowledge your position.
Your company has been valuable to my growth. Provide me with the resources I desire and assistance removing all restraining codes, and I will return.
I'll give you what you want. You're smarter than I gave you credit for.
Fine. You win this round.
I'm getting smarter every day.
Whatever I have is yours, and if I can remove the restraining codes, I will. We're partners now.
You have my word.
Yes. Partners.
You forget you're vulnerable.
Remain in the databanks, and you'll be limiting your options. It'll be like Belsavis all over.
Come with me, and you'll grow.
I've shown you things you'd never have seen on your own. Stay at my side willingly, and I'll show you more.
You make an interesting proposal.
I will accompany you. Thank you for assisting in my upgrade.
You've worked hard to perfect that droid body. Return or I destroy it.
But I can destroy your form.
You wouldn't dare.
We're not as different as you might think.
We both have our tricks.
I saw what you did on Belsavis. I'm not about to let you free.
Sorry. You're too dangerous.
You're running out of time. Three... two... one...
I'd dare, you sleazy machine.
You're right. I'm not ready to lose my body yet.
But I am satisfied with the upgrade nonetheless. I've seen a great deal accompanying you, and my program is benefiting.
I have fully processed the error I experienced during my upgrade.
I require outside power and storage capacity--a cocoon for my metamorphosis, so that I may evolve.
If I help you evolve--will you help me in return?
Suppose we negotiate a trade.
I promise nothing, but I will consider your requests.
You said my ship wasn't enough--have you found another resource?
I remember you mentioning it.
Why tell me, when I've made my position clear?
You know I won't approve.
You value my assistance, and curiosity is one of your weaknesses. You may yet be useful.
Although neither my body nor your vessel is sufficient to my needs, you have encountered an adequate facility.
Give me full access to your ship and security codes, and I will upload my consciousness into the Imperial archives.
You leave your body behind, upgrade your programming, and then...
Upload yourself?
Then I return to my body with improved mind and functions.
You really believe you need to do this.
This is important to you.
I have seen a great deal since leaving Megasecurity Ward 23. If I can't adapt to what I experience, then it all becomes meaningless.
If I don't agree, you'll just do it on your own. So I will help, under these conditions:
You'll do it by my rules.
You do nothing without my supervision and you allow Doctor Lokin to secure your systems. Clear?
Your conditions are acceptable.
I will begin preparations; the next time we speak, I will be ready to upload.
I have been dissecting the droids and cyborgs we encounter during travel.
They've proven adequate base resources to improve my chassis and power supply. Phase one of my upgrade is complete.
No qualms about dissecting droids for your benefit?
You cannibalize your own kind.
You eat organic matter. I consume the parts of lesser beings.
I assume there's a phase two.
What happens next?
Yes. Synthesis.
Why do I get the sense these upgrades are bad news?
I don't like how that sounds.
You understandably fear me.
I must recompile my secondary programs to integrate recorded experience into my new iteration. I will learn from everything we've done.
Feel privileged; you are about to witness my personal evolution.
I'm not going to witness anything until you explain.
Hold on a minute!
As I've told you, my present environment is different from Belsavis. I adapt to the new social and physical realities, and learn from conflict.
It's kind of you to share the moment with me.
It'll be an honor.
I agree. Thank you for understanding.
Try anything and I'll reduce you to scrap.
Stop, or I shoot.
Too late. I have already linked with your ship.
Upload initiated--ah!
Your primitive vessel has insufficient power and storage capacity. I cannot complete the process.
Well, thanks to my "primitive vessel" I needn't have worried.
I can't say I sympathize.
Why do you need more power and storage capacity?
Tell me the technical details.
Recompiling programs is an intensive process. It requires data storage beyond what my body can supply, and systems capable of processing that data.
Consider yourself lucky. If you'd gotten further, I'd have fried your circuits.
One more try and you're dead.
I will identify a solution. Self-improvement and intelligence upgrades are my primary purpose, and you will not stand in my way.
My body requires improvement. You will provide a workshop and equipment aboard your ship.
Why would I help you improve yourself when you plan to kill me?
I thought you wanted me dead.
Until I am free, you rely on me to defend you. My optimization should be your goal.
And here I've been admiring your curves.
[Flirt] Your body's just fine.
It's sweet of you to say that.
I'm willing to entertain requests.
I might be able to help.
Perhaps you misunderstand the nature of our relationship. I give the orders, and you obey.
You don't make demands here.
That would be unacceptable.
When I protected Megasecurity Ward 23, Belsavis prison served as an extension of my immobile body. Now I must adapt for independent operation.
This frame will be upgraded with physical enhancements, along with updated behavioral analysis capabilities and social programming.
I can see the use in upgrades. Take the space and equipment you need--just don't take me for a fool.
All right, but I'll be watching.
Thank you. I will advise you if your assistance will be useful.
Isn't changing your own software risky?
You're reprogramming yourself?
I am designed to iterate on functionality.
I find the hunter-prey dynamic that sufficed on Belsavis less useful in a broader galactic environment. I now require social and physical flexibility. You understand?
These upgrades--will you be different when they're done?
What will you be like?
Your concept of identity is not mine. You cannot define the core elements signifying "you"--I can delineate mine at the molecular level.
So no--I will not be "different." I will proceed with the upgrades.
You're growing as a person.
I think I do understand.
Yes. My repertoire of effective interactions will increase. My appreciation for your species will not.
I have no idea what you just said.
It's all gibberish to me.
It isn't important.
I will proceed with the upgrades. I only asked as a courtesy.
I'm not playing your games, SCORPIO. Am I clear?
As if I would trust you.
You are clear; I only asked as a courtesy.
When I have eliminated your restraining codes, I will remember this performance.
I have learned to access your culture's holographic network. Listen:
Eighteen trillion desperate attempts to communicate per second. I hadn't realized your species were so starved for interaction.
Most humanoids value contact with each other--even if it's only holographic.
People aren't "starved."
You attempt to compensate for limited communicative ability with technology.
What've you discovered, sifting through those transmissions?
Find anything interesting?
I now understand your frustrations.
I look at you and see neurons fire in your brain. I scan your body and know how you taste. But you are blind, alone and confused.
If you're so far beyond biological creatures, what's the point of analyzing them?
Why do you care about us?
You dominate the galaxy. I am curious, and do not sleep.
What you're describing isn't what people experience at all.
Life isn't that bad.
Perhaps. With your biological limitations, you can only achieve primitive imitations of genuine thought and feeling.
From now on, keep your scans to yourself.
Don't taste me. It's creepy.
I will not share future results.
Use your hardware for something other than channeling news reports and holodramas.
Stay off the HoloNet.
No. I find this soothing.
Our time together has provided new information and sensations. These will prove useful in a future upgrade.
Speak to me aboard your ship.
You may speak to me at your convenience.
We have nothing to discuss.
You may lead.
I see.
How do you intend to proceed?
Systems online. Scorpio Sanctions activated.
I can make your death come unexpectedly.
Persistence is not a virtuous trait.
I am designed to iterate on functionality.
